required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Clinical Trial to Evaluate the Safety and Efficacy of a Moisturizer Body Lotion in Adults of Atopic Dermatitis.
clinical_study.official_title: Single Center, Open-label, Non-randomized Clinical Trial to Evaluate the Safety and Efficacy of a Moisturizer Body Lotion in Adults With Atopic Dermatitis Presenting Dermatological Lesion.
clinical_study.source: Johnson & Johnson Consumer and Personal Products Worldwide

brief_summary.textblock: This study will evaluate the safety and efficacy of a moisturizer body lotion: the study aims to determine the tolerance of this product by the study population, and its effects on atopic dermatitis condition, skin hydration, skin barrier, skin microbiome and perceived efficacy. Participants will receive the product to use it at home for 21 +/- 2 days.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline of scores of erythema to 21 ± 2 days
primary_outcome.description: At baseline and at 21 ± 2 days, the study physician will evaluate the whole body (including face) and score the identified erythemas according to the following intensity scale: 0 (absent); 1 (mild); 2 (moderate); 3 (intense). This scale will be used to classify this skin reaction on the whole body (including face). The change from baseline will be evaluated to assess skin tolerance of the moisturizer body lotion.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline of the scores of peeling to 21 ± 2 days
primary_outcome.description: At baseline and at 21 ± 2 days, the study physician will evaluate the whole body (including face) and score the identified peelings according to the following intensity scale: 0 (absent); 1 (mild); 2 (moderate); 3 (intense). This scale will be used to classify this skin reaction on the whole body (including face). The change from baseline will be evaluated to assess skin tolerance of the moisturizer body lotion.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline of the scores of blistering to 21 ± 2 days
primary_outcome.description: At baseline and at 21 ± 2 days, the study physician will evaluate the whole body (including face) and score the identified blisterings according to the following intensity scale: 0 (absent); 1 (mild); 2 (moderate); 3 (intense). This scale will be used to classify this skin reaction on the whole body (including face). The change from baseline will be evaluated to assess skin tolerance of the moisturizer body lotion.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline of the scores of edema to 21 ± 2 days
primary_outcome.description: At baseline and at 21 ± 2 days, the study physician will evaluate the whole body (including face) and score the identified edemas according to the following intensity scale: 0 (absent); 1 (mild); 2 (moderate); 3 (intense). This scale will be used to classify this skin reaction on the whole body (including face). The change from baseline will be evaluated to assess skin tolerance of the moisturizer body lotion.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of participants with Adverse Events through 21 ± 2 days
primary_outcome.description: The percentage of participants with AEs, serious adverse events (SAEs), AEs leading to discontinuation and AEs related to skin reactions will be evaluated for skin tolerance up to 21 ± 2 days.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline of scores of erythema to 5 ± 1 days
primary_outcome.description: At baseline and at 5 ± 1 days, the study physician will evaluate the whole body (including face) and score the identified erythemas according to the following intensity scale: 0 (absent); 1 (mild); 2 (moderate); 3 (intense). This scale will be used to classify this skin reaction on the whole body (including face). The change from baseline will be evaluated to assess skin tolerance of the moisturizer body lotion.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline of the scores of peeling to 5 ± 1 days
primary_outcome.description: At baseline and at 5 ± 1 days days, the study physician will evaluate the whole body (including face) and score the identified peelings according to the following intensity scale: 0 (absent); 1 (mild); 2 (moderate); 3 (intense). This scale will be used to classify this skin reaction on the whole body (including face). The change from baseline will be evaluated to assess skin tolerance of the moisturizer body lotion.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline of the scores of blistering to 5 ± 1 days
primary_outcome.description: At baseline and at 5 ± 1 days, the study physician will evaluate the whole body (including face) and score the identified blisterings according to the following intensity scale: 0 (absent); 1 (mild); 2 (moderate); 3 (intense). This scale will be used to classify this skin reaction on the whole body (including face). The change from baseline will be evaluated to assess skin tolerance of the moisturizer body lotion.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline of the scores of edema to 5 ± 1 days
primary_outcome.description: At baseline and at 5 ± 1 days, the study physician will evaluate the whole body (including face) and score the identified edemas according to the following intensity scale: 0 (absent); 1 (mild); 2 (moderate); 3 (intense). This scale will be used to classify this skin reaction on the whole body (including face). The change from baseline will be evaluated to assess skin tolerance of the moisturizer body lotion.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline of Atopic Dermatitis severity based on Scoring Atopic Dermatitis Index (SCORAD) to 21 ± 2 days
secondary_outcome.description: Atopic dermatitis (AD) severity based on SCORAD Index will be reported at baseline and 21 ± 2 days. The tool involves not only medical assessment, but also subjective symptom assessments reported by the subject. The index is divided into the following parts, which receives a numerical score: Extension (ares with AD lesions); Intensity of reactions (erythema, edema, exudation/crusts, abrasions, lichenification and dry skin; and Subjective Symptoms (pruritus and sleep loss). To evaluate these parameters, a scale from 0 to 10 is used. At the end, a global classification of AD is automatically attributed to each subject. Lower global scores means that less severe is the AD condition. This assessment will be used to determine the effect of the moisturizer body lotion on AD condition of the study population after a period of use.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline to 5 ± 1 days of Atopic Dermatitis severity based on Scoring Atopic Dermatitis Index (SCORAD)
secondary_outcome.description: Atopic dermatitis (AD) severity based on SCORAD Index will be reported at baseline and 5 ± 1 days. The tool involves not only medical assessment, but also subjective symptom assessments reported by the subject. The index is divided into the following parts, which receives a numerical score: Extension (ares with AD lesions); Intensity of reactions (erythema, edema, exudation/crusts, abrasions, lichenification and dry skin; and Subjective Symptoms (pruritus and sleep loss). To evaluate these parameters, a scale from 0 to 10 is used. At the end, a global classification of AD is automatically attributed to each subject. Lower global scores means that less severe is the AD condition. This assessment will be used to determine the effect of the moisturizer body lotion on AD condition of the study population after a period of use.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from 5 ± 1 days of Atopic Dermatitis severity based on Scoring Atopic Dermatitis Index (SCORAD) to 21 ± 2 days
secondary_outcome.description: Atopic dermatitis (AD) severity based on SCORAD Index will be reported at 5 ± 1 days and 21 ± 2 days. The tool involves not only medical assessment, but also subjective symptom assessments reported by the subject. The index is divided into the following parts, which receives a numerical score: Extension (ares with AD lesions); Intensity of reactions (erythema, edema, exudation/crusts, abrasions, lichenification and dry skin; and Subjective Symptoms (pruritus and sleep loss). To evaluate these parameters, a scale from 0 to 10 is used. At the end, a global classification of AD is automatically attributed to each subject. Lower global scores means that less severe is the AD condition. This assessment will be used to determine the effect of the moisturizer body lotion on AD condition of the study population after a period of use.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean change from baseline to 21 ± 2 days in skin hydration level of areas with and without AD lesions
secondary_outcome.description: Skin hydration level of areas with and without AD lesions will be measured with corneometer, a recognized device that determine the water content of stratum corneum. This measure will be used to determine the effect of the moisturizer body lotion on skin hydration of the study population after a period of use.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean change from baseline to 5 ± 1 days in skin hydration level of areas with and without AD lesions
secondary_outcome.description: Skin hydration level of areas with and without AD lesions will be measured with corneometer, a recognized device that determine the water content of stratum corneum. This measure will be used to determine the effect of the moisturizer body lotion on skin hydration of the study population after a period of use.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean change from 5 ± 1 days to 21 ± 2 days in skin hydration level of areas with and without AD lesions
secondary_outcome.description: Skin hydration level of areas with and without AD lesions will be measured with corneometer, a recognized device that determine the water content of stratum corneum. This measure will be used to determine the effect of the moisturizer body lotion on skin hydration of the study population after a period of use.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean change from baseline to 21 ± 2 days in transepidermal water loss (TEWL) to assess skin barrier integrity of areas with and without AD lesions
secondary_outcome.description: Skin barrier integrity of areas with and without AD lesions will be evaluated using a recognized device that determine the transepidermal water loss. Lower levels of TEWL may be related to a more integrate skin barrier. This measure will be used to determine the effect of the moisturizer body lotion on skin barrier of the study population after a period of use.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean change from baseline to 5 ± 1 days in transepidermal water loss (TEWL) to assess skin barrier integrity of areas with and without AD lesions
secondary_outcome.description: Skin barrier integrity of areas with and without AD lesions will be evaluated using a recognized device that determine the transepidermal water loss. Lower levels of TEWL may be related to a more integrate skin barrier. This measure will be used to determine the effect of the moisturizer body lotion on skin barrier of the study population after a period of use.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean change from 5 ± 1 days to 21 ± 2 days in transepidermal water loss (TEWL) to assess skin barrier integrity of areas with and without AD lesions
secondary_outcome.description: Skin barrier integrity of areas with and without AD lesions will be evaluated using a recognized device that determine the transepidermal water loss. Lower levels of TEWL may be related to a more integrate skin barrier. This measure will be used to determine the effect of the moisturizer body lotion on skin barrier of the study population after a period of use.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean change from baseline to 21 ± 2 days in the Patient-Oriented Eczema Measure (POEM) total score to assess AD severity
secondary_outcome.description: The POEM is a simple, valid, easily interpreted, and reproducible tool for assessing AD and monitoring aspects of the disease that are important to participants with AD. This tool consists in a questionnaire responded by the participants with questions related to seven AD symptoms (itchy skin, sleep disturbance, bleeding skin, skin weeping/oozing, skin flaking, skin cracking, skin dryness/roughness). Participants must respond each questions specifying how many times per week the symptoms occur using the options: none day; 1 to 2 days; 3 to 4 days; 5 to 6 days; every day. Then each response receives the one of the following scores: 0 = no days; 1= 1-2 days; 2 = 3-4 days; 3 = 5-6 days 4= every day. In the end, a total score is calculated by the sum of the 7 items (rating from 0 to 28). Higher scores correlates to a more severe AD condition. This measure will be used to determine the effect of the moisturizer body lotion on AD condition of the study population after a period of use.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean change from baseline to 7 days in the Patient-Oriented Eczema Measure (POEM) total score to assess AD severity
secondary_outcome.description: The POEM is a simple, valid, easily interpreted, and reproducible tool for assessing AD and monitoring aspects of the disease that are important to participants with AD. This tool consists in a questionnaire responded by the participants with questions related to seven AD symptoms (itchy skin, sleep disturbance, bleeding skin, skin weeping/oozing, skin flaking, skin cracking, skin dryness/roughness). Participants must respond each questions specifying how many times per week the symptoms occur using the options: none day; 1 to 2 days; 3 to 4 days; 5 to 6 days; every day. Then each response receives the one of the following scores: 0 = no days; 1= 1-2 days; 2 = 3-4 days; 3 = 5-6 days 4= every day. In the end, a total score is calculated by the sum of the 7 items (rating from 0 to 28). Higher scores correlates to a more severe AD condition. This measure will be used to determine the effect of the moisturizer body lotion on AD condition of the study population after a period of use.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean change from baseline to 14 days in the Patient-Oriented Eczema Measure (POEM) total score to assess AD severity
secondary_outcome.description: The POEM is a simple, valid, easily interpreted, and reproducible tool for assessing AD and monitoring aspects of the disease that are important to participants with AD. This tool consists in a questionnaire responded by the participants with questions related to seven AD symptoms (itchy skin, sleep disturbance, bleeding skin, skin weeping/oozing, skin flaking, skin cracking, skin dryness/roughness). Participants must respond each questions specifying how many times per week the symptoms occur using the options: none day; 1 to 2 days; 3 to 4 days; 5 to 6 days; every day. Then each response receives the one of the following scores: 0 = no days; 1= 1-2 days; 2 = 3-4 days; 3 = 5-6 days 4= every day. In the end, a total score is calculated by the sum of the 7 items (rating from 0 to 28). Higher scores correlates to a more severe AD condition. This measure will be used to determine the effect of the moisturizer body lotion on AD condition of the study population after a period of use.

secondary_outcome.measure: Perceived Efficacy of the quality of life at baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Perceived efficacy related to the quality of life will be subjectively evaluated by the participants through a questionnaire with questions related to the impact of AD in the quality of life. Participants will answer each question using the following qualitative scale: Affected very much; moderately affected; affected a little; did not affected. This questionnaire will be used to evaluate the impact of AD in the quality of life before investigational product "Moisturizer body lotion" is used. The responses for each questions will be provided as percentages.

secondary_outcome.measure: Perceived Efficacy in the quality of life at 7 days
secondary_outcome.description: Perceived efficacy related to the quality of life will be subjectively evaluated by the participants through a questionnaire with questions related to the improvement in the quality of life after 7 days of moisturizer body lotion usage. Participants will answer each question using the following qualitative scale: Helped very much; moderately helped; helped a little; did not helped. This questionnaire will be used to evaluate the impact of the moisturizer body lotion in the quality of life after periods of use of this product. The responses for each questions will be provided as percentages.

secondary_outcome.measure: Perceived Efficacy in the quality of life at 14 days
secondary_outcome.description: Perceived efficacy related to the quality of life will be subjectively evaluated by the participants through a questionnaire with questions related to the improvement in the quality of life after 14 days of moisturizer body lotion usage. Participants will answer each question using the following qualitative scale: Helped very much; moderately helped; helped a little; did not helped. This questionnaire will be used to evaluate the impact of the moisturizer body lotion in the quality of life after periods of use of this product. The responses for each questions will be provided as percentages.

secondary_outcome.measure: Perceived Efficacy in the quality of life at 21 ± 2 days
secondary_outcome.description: Perceived efficacy related to the quality of life will be subjectively evaluated by the participants through a questionnaire with questions related to the improvement in the quality of life after 21 ± 2 days of moisturizer body lotion usage. Participants will answer each question using the following qualitative scale: Helped very much; moderately helped; helped a little; did not helped. This questionnaire will be used to evaluate the impact of the moisturizer body lotion in the quality of life after periods of use of this product. The responses for each questions will be provided as percentages.

secondary_outcome.measure: Perceived Efficacy of the moisturizer body lotion at 7 days
secondary_outcome.description: Perceived efficacy related to the attributes of moisturizer body lotions will be subjectively evaluated by the participants through a questionnaire using the following qualitative scale: totally agree; agree; neither agree nor disagree; disagree; totally disagree. The responses for each questions will be provided as percentages.

secondary_outcome.measure: Perceived Efficacy of the moisturizer body lotion at 14 days
secondary_outcome.description: Perceived efficacy related to the attributes of moisturizer body lotions will be subjectively evaluated by the participants through a questionnaire using the following qualitative scale: totally agree; agree; neither agree nor disagree; disagree; totally disagree. The responses for each questions will be provided as percentages.

secondary_outcome.measure: Perceived Efficacy of the moisturizer body lotion at 21 ± 2 days
secondary_outcome.description: Perceived efficacy related to the attributes of moisturizer body lotions will be subjectively evaluated by the participants through a questionnaire using the following qualitative scale: totally agree; agree; neither agree nor disagree; disagree; totally disagree. The responses for each questions will be provided as percentages.

secondary_outcome.measure: Determination of types and quantity of bacteria (skin microbiome) of areas with and without AD lesions at baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Skin microbiome is a group of microorganisms, including bacteria, present on the skin surface and plays an important role in AD. To evaluate the type and number of bacteria present on the surface of areas with and without AD lesions, a sample will be collected on this areas using a swab. The evaluation will be done through metagenomics, a technique that allows the determination of the types and quantity of bacteria present in an specific area. This assessment will be used to determine the effect of the moisturizer body lotion on skin microbiome after a period of use.

secondary_outcome.measure: Determination of types and quantity of bacteria (skin microbiome) of areas with and without AD lesions at 21 ± 2 days
secondary_outcome.description: Skin microbiome is a group of microorganisms, including bacteria, present on the skin surface and plays an important role in AD. To evaluate the type and number of bacteria present on the surface of areas with and without AD lesions, a sample will be collected on this areas using a swab. The evaluation will be done through metagenomics, a technique that allows the determination of the types and quantity of bacteria present in an specific area. This assessment will be used to determine the effect of the moisturizer body lotion on skin microbiome after a period of use.

secondary_outcome.measure: Visual skin condition of areas with and without AD lesions at baseline captured photographically
secondary_outcome.description: Images of areas with and without AD lesions will be captured through a professional camera at baseline to visualize the skin condition of these areas before the use of moisturizer body lotion. No analysis is planned. These images will be used as a qualitative complement to the other results for moisturizer body lotion.

secondary_outcome.measure: Visual skin condition of areas with and without AD lesions at 5 ± 1 days captured photographically
secondary_outcome.description: Images of areas with and without AD lesions will be captured through a professional camera at 5 ± 1 days to visualize the skin condition of these areas after the use of moisturizer body lotion. No analysis is planned. These images will be used as a qualitative complement to the other results for moisturizer body lotion.

secondary_outcome.measure: Visual skin condition of areas with and without AD lesions at 21 ± 2 days captured photographically
secondary_outcome.description: Images of areas with and without AD lesions will be captured through a professional camera at 21 ± 2 days to visualize the skin condition of these areas after the use of moisturizer body lotion. No analysis is planned. These images will be used as a qualitative complement to the other results for moisturizer body lotion.

secondary_outcome.measure: Testimonial regarding the experience with moisturizer body lotion at 21 ± 2 days
secondary_outcome.description: A testimonial regarding the experience with moisturizer body lotion will be provided by the participants through an open question at the end of the study. The purpose is to know their opinion and experience using this product during the study.

arm_group.description: All participants will receive the product and use it at home.

intervention.other_name: The body lotion product is a moisturizing formulation intended for topical use on the whole body and face. It will be applied at least twice daily.

patient_data.ipd_description: Johnson & Johnson Consumer Inc. has an agreement with the Yale Open Data Access (YODA) Project to serve as the independent review panel for evaluation of requests for clinical study reports and participant level data from investigators and physicians for scientific research that will advance medical knowledge and public health. Requests for access to the study data can be submitted through the YODA Project site at http://yoda.yale.edu.
